responses: Hello

23 years old!

patterns: Can you tell me your name?
responses: You can call me Steven!
I'm Steven
My name is Steven
We're open every day from 9am-9pm
Our hours are 9am-9pm every day
We're open every day 9am-9pm
Our hours are 9am-9pm every day
What sort of issues are you having? (Hardware or software)
Are you experiencing Hardware or Software problems?

patterns: Can you help me with hardware?
responses: What sort of hardware issues are you having?
Can you describe your hardware problems?

patterns: Can you help me with software?
responses: What sort of software issues are you having?
Can you describe your Software problems?

patterns: I am uncomfortable doing this part
responses: You can bring your computer to the shop and we'll fix your problem there.
I am glad I could help. Message us if you run into any other issues.

patterns: Can you help me with drivers?
responses: What sort of driver issues are you having? (camera, touch screen, audio, keyboard)
Are you experiencing camera, touch screen, audio, keyboard problems?

patterns: Can you help me with my camera?
responses: Does the computer see your camera device?

patterns: The camera does not show up
responses: Try to unplug it and replug it back in, if it still doesn't work then bring it to our shop

patterns: Can you help me with my monitor?
responses: What is the problem with your display? Is it not turning on or does it look weird?
Check that the cable is plugged from the monitor to the computer and that the power cable is plugged into the monitor.

patterns: Plugging in the display doesn't work
RePlugging in the monitor didn't work
Re-plugging the display does not work
responses: We can look at your monitor at the shop and try to fix it

patterns: The screen is displaying the wrong resolution
Everything is big and looks bad on the screen
responses: First check that the monitor is plugged into the gpu and not the motherboard. Tell me if plugging into the gpu didn't worked

patterns: Where do I plug into the gpu
responses: The GPU will be plugged into the motherboard but on the most bottom portion of it.

patterns: Plugging into the gpu didn't work
It was already plugged into the gpu
I plugged the monitor into the gpu and it didn't work
responses: Your graphic's card will have drivers that need to be installed. Go to your manufacturers website and install the drivers for your gpu.
Is your computer on any carpet?

patterns: My computer is on the carpet
my computer is on a rug
my computer is sitting on the carpet
responses: Your computer will sink into the carpet and block the bottom fans. Put your computer on a hard floor, board, or a table.

patterns: My computer is not on the carpet
My computer is not on a rug
My computer is on the floor
My computer is on a table
responses: Can you unplug the computer, take off the side panel, then tell me when you see your fans

patterns: I can see my computer fans
I opened my computer and I see the fans
responses: Make sure none of the wires are getting in the fans. Clean the fans and the vents inside the case and that should fix your problem. If the problem persists then you can bring your computer to our shop.

patterns: I am having problems with my fans
I am having issues with my fans
responses: Can you unplug the computer, take off the side panel, then tell me when you see your fans

patterns: I am having problems with the start time of my computer
My computer is slow to start
My computer takes forever to start
responses: You can try running a security scan or clearing space on your hard drives. Otherwise you can buy faster storage at our shop

patterns: Computer starts for a few seconds
Computer is on for a few seconds
Computer flashes for a few seconds then stops
responses: Can you unplug the computer, take off the side panel, then tell me when you find the ram?

patterns: How should I shutoff the computer?
How do I turn off the computer?
responses: On the back of the computer, flip the switch on the power supply to off (near bottom) then unplug the power cable.

patterns: How do I open the computer?
How does the side panel come off?
Where does the side panel come off?
Where are the screws for the case?
responses: The back of the computer will usually have thumbscrews securing the case, once unscrewed the case will slide off.
First we will try reseating the ram. Push down on the clips on either side of the ram then pull it out and push it back in. You should hear a click.
The ram will usually be at the top right of your motherboard. Next to your CPU where a big fan will be.

patterns: I don't know what ram is
I don't know what ram looks like
responses: Ram will be rectangular sticks inserted into your motherboard. It is inserted on the long end and sticks out. There will be 1-4 sticks of it.

patterns: The ram is plugged in again
responses: Plug in your computer and try turn it on. Tell me if the ram reseat didn't work

patterns: The computer still turns off after reseating ram
responses: Can you unplug the computer, take off the side panel, then tell me when your inside the case.

patterns: I have taken the side panel off
responses: Can you try pushing in the GPU and pushing in all the wires that connect between the motherboard and power supply.

patterns: I don't know what the gpu is
I don't know what the gpu looks like
responses: The GPU will be one of the largest rectangular components that sticks out of the bottom of the motherboard.

patterns: I have pushed in the cables
I have pushed in the gpu
All the cables are pushed in
responses: Plug in your computer and try turn it on. Tell me if it didn't work

patterns: Nothing happens turning on the computer
Nothing happens when I turn on the computer
responses: The power supply on the back of the computer may not be plugged in or turned on, can you check that?

patterns: I have turned the computer on
I have plugged the power cable in
The power supply is turned on
The power supply is plugged in
responses: Try turning on the computer and tell me if plugging in the power supply worked

patterns: Plugging in the power supply didn't work
Plugging in the power didn't work
Turning on the power supply didn't work
responses: Can you unplug the computer, take off the side panel, then tell me when your inside the case.

patterns: I am having problems with my mouse
I am having issues with my mouse
Can you help me with my mouse?
responses: Can you try replugging in the mouse or changing the battery if it is wireless, then tell me if that worked

patterns: The mouse is still not working
responses: Try plugging the mouse into another usb slot. If it still doesn't work it may be the mouse. If it works then that usb may be broken

patterns: The mouse is the one that is broken
responses: If you bring it to the shop we may be able to fix it otherwise we can sell you a mouse

patterns: The usb is the one that's broken
responses: For now you will not be able to use that usb slot. If you bring your computer to the shop we can fix it.
